Performing a urine microscopy for malignant cells can be an effective diagnostic method to determine the cause of hematuria in a 60 year old chronic smoker who is presenting with painless gross hematuria of one day duration. This type of exam can help detect the presence of any abnormal cells, including malignant ones, in the urine. A Urologist in the US earns an income of about $371,478 annually in the US. Additionally, a urine routine, x-ray KUB, or ultrasound may also be necessary to confirm or rule out other potential causes of the hematuria in the urine.

data.sampled:
a) Adjustable gastric banding
c) Duodenal Switch
d) Roux en Y Duodenal By pass

Explanation:
a) Adjustable gastric banding is not a surgical option for morbid obesity. It is a minimally invasive, adjustable device that is placed around the stomach to restrict food intake.

b) Biliopancreatic diversion is a weight loss surgery where a portion of the stomach is removed and the remaining stomach is attached to the small intestine.

c) Duodenal Switch is a bariatric surgery that involves removing a portion of the stomach and bypassing a portion of the small intestine.

d) Roux-en-Y Duodenal By-pass is a weight loss surgery where a portion of the stomach is removed and the remaining stomach is attached to the small intestine. SOURCE: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bariatric_surgery

Please evaluate my answer. Did I get it correct? If not, please describe the accurate response. And provide the suggested answer.

Your answer is correct! Great work!
The correct answer is c) Duodenal Switch. This is a bariatric surgery that involves removing a portion of the stomach and bypassing a portion of the small intestine, and it is a surgical option for morbid obesity. Adjustable gastric banding is not a surgical option for morbid obesity. It is a minimally invasive, adjustable device that is placed around the stomach to restrict food intake. Biliopancreatic diversion is a weight loss surgery where a portion of the stomach is removed and the remaining stomach is attached to the small intestine. Roux-en-Y Duodenal By-pass is a weight loss surgery where a portion of the stomach is removed and the remaining stomach is attached to the small intestine. SOURCE: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bariatric_surgery

Please proceed with the next question! And thanks for your evaluaion as well!

b) Cimetidine
c) Finasteride

e) Diltiazem
f) Levothyroxine
